text: Keri Rose Lawson-Te Aho is a New Zealand academic specialising in studying mental health issues and suicide amongst New Zealand's Māori people. == Biography == In 1995–96, Lawson-Te Aho was a Fulbright scholar and visiting research fellow at the East-West Center in Hawaii. She later travelled in indigenous communities in Alaska and other parts of North America, working on suicide prevention and tribal self-determination projects. Lawson-Te Aho is a lecturer at the University of Otago's Wellington School of Medicine. ==References== Category:Living people Category:University of Otago faculty Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Keri Lawson-Te Aho
